com.absio.crypto.key

Class KeyRing

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.crypto.key.KeyRing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPublicKeySource

    public class KeyRing
extends Object
implements IPublicKeySource
    This represents a "users" key ring in the Absio ecosystem. A key ring is made up of the user's ID, and a historical list of their signing and derivation keys. These keys are all private elliptical curve keys - see IndexedECPrivateKey. This has a helper methods to return the latest active key of each type (signing or derivation). That will return the active key with the largest index.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyRing

        public KeyRing(UUID userId,
               ArrayList<IndexedECPrivateKey> derivationKeys,
               ArrayList<IndexedECPrivateKey> signingKeys)
        Create a key ring with the give user id, derivation keys and signing keys.
        Parameters:
        userId - the UUID of the user
        derivationKeys - a list of derivation keys (see IndexedECPrivateKey)
        signingKeys - a list of signing keys (see IndexedECPrivateKey)

      • KeyRing

        public KeyRing()
        throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
               NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Default constructor.

        This will create one random active signing and derivation key with an index of 0 and a null user ID.

        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the JCE does not support the algorithm of the key
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - thrown if the parameters of the algorithm are not supported

      • KeyRing

        public KeyRing(UUID userId)
        throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
               InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Create a key ring with the given user id. This will create one random active signing and and derivation key with an index of 0.
        Parameters:
        userId - the UUID of the user
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the JCE does not support the algorithm of the key
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - thrown if the parameters of the algorithm are not supported

      • KeyRing

        public KeyRing(ArrayList<IndexedECPrivateKey> derivationKeys,
               ArrayList<IndexedECPrivateKey> signingKeys)
        Create a key ring with the given derivation and signing keys. The user id will be null
        Parameters:
        derivationKeys - a list of derivation keys (see IndexedECPrivateKey)
        signingKeys - a list of signing keys (see IndexedECPrivateKey)

      • getLatestActive

        public IndexedECPublicKey getLatestActive(UUID userId,
                                          KeyType type)
        Description copied from interface: IPublicKeySource
        This gets the latest active public key that match the user ID and type.

        NOTE: if there is not an active key null will be returned.

        Specified by:
        getLatestActive in interface IPublicKeySource
        Parameters:
        userId - the user's ID
        type - the KeyType of public key
        Returns:
        the latest active public key for the user of the specified KeyType
